name: The Forgotten Ones
description: Losing his parents during the holocaust to a mad man of a doctor. You're to play as Grobuskna Vladinov, 20 years after the incident that changed his life dramatically. Grobuskna receives an unknown phone call that'll start a journey that'll twist your mind...
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP/Vista/7/8 Processor: 3.0 GHz P4, Dual Core 2.0 (or higher) or AMD64X2 (or higher) Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Video card must be 128 MB or more and should be a DirectX 9-compatible with support for Pixel Shader 2.0b (ATI Radeon X800 or higher / NVIDIA GeForce 7600 or higher / Intel HD Graphics 2000 or higher - *NOT* an Express graphics card). DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 6 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX 9.0c compatible
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows XP/Vista/7/8 Processor: 3.0 GHz P4, Dual Core 2.0 (or higher) or AMD64X2 (or higher) Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: Video card must be 128 MB or more and should be a DirectX 9-compatible with support for Pixel Shader 2.0b (ATI Radeon X800 or higher / NVIDIA GeForce 7600 or higher / Intel HD Graphics 2000 or higher - *NOT* an Express graphics card). DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 6 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX 9.0c compatible

reviews.review_text: Update: Having now completed the game. I have added a few more bullet points (in italics). Mild spoilers.     I have no idea what's happening storywise.    The enemies look ridiculous and are hard to beat unless you can pre-empt them.    Your character's name changes subtly with every person who tries to pronounce it.    There is a strong possibility you'll drop a lung laughing at the jump scares.    It tries to imitate Slenderman by using what I can only assume is a Source version of ET, and even then they fail to have it chase you.    And I'm pretty sure I missed an item I need in an area I'm now locked out of.   I got killed by an exploding chest with a russian man dancing on it while 'who let the dogs out' played until I quit.    Puzzles include  tilting a Hitler painting to move a bookcase, but only AFTER some enemies have appeared , and articulation of this idea is totally non-existent.    One puzzle requires a circular saw. There is a circular saw in the room, but you can't use it for whatever reason. You need one from somewhere else.   You will lose contact with the floor and get stuck in jump animation loops when walking over objects like 'newspaper' and 'stairs'   One of the bosses appear twice because... I'm not sure.   The rest of the bosses are poorly explained, or just dumb.   Some enemies are spawned next to doors. These enemies will absorb 15 rounds from the MP-40, but down you with 3-4 knife hits.    You will never, ever, pick up the ammo in front of you first. You will magnetically attract buckets and chairs first, and once they're gone you'll still be at the wrong angle/distance to obtain the ammo.   The story is no clearer by the end than the begininning. Not sure if it's there at all, actually.   Final boss sucks. Not sure you can even call it a boss.   You can't enter the final area until you do some convoluted ♥♥♥♥ to turn the lights on because 'it's dark down there'. I was holding a torch. And it turns out some people were  fighting off waves of enemies for a long time  down there. Apparently in the dark.  [/i]  [/list]  There you have it. Still recommending it (for comedy purposes):  10/10  However, as an actual game:  3/10
Great game.......If you've played 'Cry of Fear' and liked it, then this game is for you......

Could have been better if they fixed the glitches, the story is alittle bit cheesy. It's a good game but the game needs many adjustment from the story to actual gameplay. The game could have been better. But it's still a good game.

I don´t need a review about this game,beacuse you need to play it without no one tell you what to do or what is good or bad about it.  Things that I like: _History _Old classic gameplay _Rich architecture _A lot to explore _Big open outdoors areas _Ambient _Source SDK _Inspired by Resident Evil 1 _The developer team  Thing that I don´t like: _Loading screens _Voice acting _No directions  RATE: 8.5/10

this game is truely scary, not to the point where it makes it to scary but its got that perfect balance aswel as an amazing story line. it starts off a bit slow but trust me give it a chance and you will find yourself playing for hours on end. love it

The graphics in the game remind me of the old Doom style as well as having the first person perspective. It is a fairly smooth game doesnt seem to really get hung up on any of the changing scenes I have tried. There is tension in the game almost from the very begining, The music really adds to the atmosphere as well as the other sounds involving unseen as of yet characters/npcs. It seems ot be a puzzle game the sort where you really have to figure out what your doing as you go along. I admit that I did not delve very deeply into the game as I am not a huge fan of horror/suspense, but I think this game has hit it on the head of the nail. I am probably going to let my wife, who is into this sort of game much more than I am have a go at it.

I would diffently recommend this game to people Im having a great time playing this game maybe not at the beginning cause i didn't know what to do but after that i had alot of fun with the jump scares and the pewdiepie things was actually kinda entertaining gave me something to look forward to find cause of funny things I would get this game cause it's free to now dats nice aint it

for some reason this game gives me a huge burst of nostalgia whenever i play it. I just love it so muhc and idk why. But as an unbiased opinion this game is pretty fun, and i mean its free and its a source mod. So im not really complaining.

This is one of those games where I wish there was a 'neutral' rating.  This game isn't very long, but it is fairly spooky and grim. The graphics are not much better than what you would find in Half-Life 2. Sometimes this works against the game because there are a lot of reflective effects and that makes it hard to see. This isn't the worst problem.  The AI isn't really that great, and can be easily thwarted if you stand on something. It will walk up to you, but it can't attack. You can whack whatever is trying to kill you pretty quickly with anything on hand. This isn't even necessary, since there is enough ammunition to kill mostly everything you come across, unless you are a horrendously bad shot. The environment isn't that well constructed and, regretably, this persists to the end of the game.   That being said, the story is pretty grim, but that is to be expected with a sociopath nazi doctor. The manor is pretty spooky, and the game is thankfully mild with the jump-scares. I just wish there was less ammunition and more room to maneuver and there was an opportunity to hide. Basically, I wish this game was more like Amnesia.   The controls, music, and voice acting are fairly competent, but the translations are bad. They are not bad enough to be completely indecipherable, but the developers could have done better. They could have definitely done better with the climax and the ending, as the last chapter has a puzzle that makes no sense and a fight that was just not that good. The ending was odd as well.   All of this being said, the game was fun enough for me to play it all the way through and go after the acheivements.
not bad horror style
Hey.. That's pretty good.
This is just like Cry of fear...lol  I accidently killed myself with a chair...

The Forgotten Ones is an extraordinary game. Mixed with a bit of Amnesia and some other small horror video games allows you to experience a game of its own kind. Although there is quiet a bit of room for improvement, with small things like place names (The Swastika Forest... really?), the gameplay made up for the gaps in other aspects. The graphics remind me of Counter Strike Source and Half Life 2 although.   Recommended 7/10

Let me get this straight, you want me to tell you a review about this game? Whoever you are, you might as well go to the curators, because if you've come for a review on this game, you've come to the wrong place. However, if you have come for an outstanding chocolate chip cookie recipe, you've come to the right place. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Ingredients 1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter 3/4 cup packed dark brown sugar 3/4 cup sugar 2 large eggs 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract 1 (12-ounce) bag semisweet chocolate chips, or chunks 2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour 3/4 teaspoon baking soda 1 teaspoon fine salt  Directions 1. Evenly position 2 racks in the middle of the oven and preheat to 375 degrees F. (on convection setting if you have it.) Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone sheets. (If you only have 1 baking sheet, let it cool completely between batches.)  2. Put the butter in a microwave safe bowl, cover and microwave on medium power until melted. (Alternatively melt in a small saucepan.) Cool slightly. Whisk the sugars, eggs, butter and vanilla in a large bowl until smooth.  3. Whisk the flour, baking soda and salt in another bowl. Stir the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients with a wooden spoon; take care not to over mix. Stir in the chocolate chips or chunks.  4. Scoop heaping tablespoons of the dough onto the prepared pans. Wet hands slightly and roll the dough into balls. Space the cookies about 2-inches apart on the pans. Bake, until golden, but still soft in the center, 12 to 16 minutes, depending on how chewy or crunchy you like your cookies. Transfer hot cookies with a spatula to a rack to cool. Serve.  5. Store cookies in a tightly sealed container for up to 5 days.  For a Rocky Road Bar: 1. Lightly butter a 9 by 13-inch baking pan. Make the batter as per cookie recipe and fold in 1 cup chopped walnuts along with the chocolate chips. Spread batter in prepared pan. Bake until the edges are light brown and the batter sets, about 45 minutes. Cool slightly and cover surface with 4 cups marshmallows and 1 cup chocolate chips. Broil at least 8 inches from the heat until marshmallows turn golden brown, about 2 minutes. (Keep an eye on the marshmallows, and turn the pan frequently--they go from golden to char in a wink.) Cool, cut and serve.

I've just had a look at the 'kinda useful Guide' - I got to a certain point just outside the House before going into the Tunnel. It was kind of a relief, like getting a grip on reality, reading and realising how other people had been through (more-or-less) the same experience I had just had. Jeez that was scary as ..... I'm really enjoying feeling my way around, and getting jumped out-at so I may not go back to the guide this first time around. Although did somehow the Garden Shed get forgotten? I do not want to give a spoiler so I won't go into it - what happens, not the shed I mean... Mind you, the 'Kinda useful guide' kind of gives away more from what it DOESN'T tell you (like the Garden Shed), than what it does. When you have played the game some you will figure out what it is Chronos is writing between-the-lines. And that is that the 'exploring' (sic) side of things, in between picking up things or killing things, unless you are a truly hardened horror-fan (or maybe one of the undead), is the very last thing you will want to be doing as you play the game. You constantly want to be out-of-there, with all this horrible nightmare cleared up by the good guys. But in 'The Forgotten Ones' there is only you..., and some fairly feeble weaponry considering what you will have to face. I don't want to suggest that this turns itself into a gore-blaster, that would spoil the dangerous fear you will experience playing it. There are plenty of games during which you need never fear, because you have a .50 cal - or a zip-saw or whatever, which will decimate, given a reasonable aim and a sensible approach, anything that is likely to move against you. I don't generally play horror games, I'm a WWII gamer at heart, it was the story-line that caught my eye and got me to try it out. So far, I found the game drew me in quickly to become a hellishly scary experience - and it definitely gets my vote. I only downloaded yesterday so I guess I got the patched version, there isn't really anything to complain about. I read some bad-reviews and had those in mind when I installed it, but pleased to say, and I don't have a top-whack pc, the game is running fine for me. The key action for the Hotel got a bit sticky, but a couple of try's and it was OK. Opening it up for user-made stories, that is truly awesome, and in the true gamer spirit. It's getting dark now, so I guess I'll have to wait till tomorrow before I can explore some more...

At first I was going to give this game a 2/10, but then I remembered all the amazing things I witnessed in less than an hour of playing:  -Bad voice acting muddled with old/grainy effects to cover up how bad it is -Bad voice acting you CAN'T EVEN HEAR because the audio is ♥♥♥♥ed -A car that goes 150mph if you hit shift while going at a snail's pace (please get the game just to play this part, it's hilarious) -The usual stellar running mechanics that make your middle-aged yet fit ♥♥♥ tired after doing a brisk jog for ten yards -You walk like a crippled twelve year old: slowly -Want to reload while missing one bullet? Excellent, you lose all the bullets. Because your ♥♥♥ is too stupid to pick the clip up again later and shove a bullet in it or even save the clip altogether. -Running and hitting animations suitable for my autistic uncle -Notes written by 13 year olds who keep continously flunking the fifth grade -Jump scares every 30 seconds that make you want to burst out laughing at how terrible they are. Amazing, highly recommend. -Monsters that can hit you 3 times in a single second and do not stop long enough for you to shoot/hit them back properly -Dying -Dying -Still dying because that monster hitting you makes it impossible to shoot them back -Dying -Surving just once luckily -Having two of said monsters spawn right outside of a tiny room and waltz right in on you LESS THAN 15 SECONDS AFTER YOU GOT PAST THE LAST ONE -♥♥♥♥thisshit.jpeg -Quit -Instant uninstall  The game is truly astounding, a masterpiece birthed into our world by a remarkable man. The morals of this story are the voice of our generation, and truly touch upon what is dear to our hearts. This game will certainly be remembered for it's thrilling action and fair yet challenging combat.  13/10

This game is great; disregard the bad reviews. I played this with a friend beside me at 2:00 AM, we were laughing our asses off. We spent 10 minutes blocking a door so we wouldn't get killed by a monster, and one of the jumpstares was dubbed 'Electro Spook' since he slid at very high speeds. Spooky Scary Skeletons was played over the playthrough; it got many laughs. Might not be the highest quality, but play it with friends. It's worth it.

PROS: - long play time (7 hours) - nice looking graphics (nothing special) - very atmospheric - challenging difficulty - some easter eggs to find  CONS: - easy to get lost - sometimes the game becomes a bit frustrating - you may need a guide to finish it  RESULT: I can really recommend it. In my oppinion it's a better horror game then Cry Of Fear. It's very atmospheric and I really jumpscared a few times. But it's pretty dark and ambient driven horror, what I like personally more. The game is also very long, 7 hours is really not bad. Another half hour was needed for completing. :) To finish the game isn't easy, because the enemies are really hard to beat and you can get easily lost. The question 'Where should I go?' was the only really bad thing I've ever experienced in this game. Some passages could be frustrating for not that experienced players. But please take your time to learn how to act against which enemy. Everything is doable. It only needs some time, sometimes. :D If you stay with a will to see the ending, it's really rewarding and an enjoyable horror game after all. :) (\ô/)

I enjoy how this game does not just drop you into the action. It starts off with a story. Not a very well developed story... but it is enough to make you jump at every sound and movement and constantly watch your back. When I did meet my first enemy, I nearly slammed my mouse into my wall, which is a good 2 feet away. The gameplay mechanics take a little while to get used to but they are not bad ones. The amount of ammo that they give you is pretty good until you start encountering more enemies, then it slowly drains because you jump and fire off half your shots at the sky in terror. Out of every free horror game I have had the chance to play, The Forgotten Ones and Cry Of Fear both fall into my top slots.

Gregor is in the room with me and I can't seem to do anything to advance in the game.   Any help would be appreciated or just let me know this is a bug so I don't blow my brains out. LoL   Thanks!

Despite this being a free to play game, I still find myself compelled to write a negative review for it.  The core gameplay is broken. Enemies move too quickly, and are extremely difficult to shoot (pretty much impossible once they are right up next to you). The exploration is boring and the level design is overly complex at times. The main menu and inventory use this awful LOUD “ding” sound when you highlight different things. It’s incredibly off putting and just plain annoying.   I’m surprised I made it over an hour into the game, but I suppose my love for the source engine is stronger than I thought. Not strong enough to finish it though.

From a promising start with decent atmosphere, the game takes a nose dive as soon as you enter the hotel. Could have been good, but horrible bugs, horrible gameplay, and horrible scares definitely don't add up to a good horror game.

I didn't get very far before I got frustrated and gave up.  Just a note to future devs, ♥♥♥♥ing stop with the stanima ♥♥♥♥. Stop taking control away from me, please.  That wasn't why I quit though, I quit because I got a 'SSSLENDER??' achievement, that was the straw that broke that camel's back. I didn't get to combat but I'll take everyone's word on it that it is ♥♥♥♥.   How fat is the player character? 800 pounds? He can't jump 3 times without panting and being forced to crawl. What the ♥♥♥♥.

From the trailer to the beginning of the game it looks promising. Atmosphere is great. The voice is acting is a MEH. But when you get to the hotel, OH BOY arnt you in for a treat. When you get to the hotel, the 'action' and horror start. It has some ok horror, the AI however... is not ok. The enemies in this game are a suppose to be a scary 2 headed creature but in acuality, they are robots that ATTACK NON-STOP! I was stuck on the first level because it will throw 2 ONE COMMAND ROBOTS to destroy you. OH, the only way to get a LMG in this game... beat the game or donate. Getting an INFINITE AMMO LMG requires you to PAY or TRY and beat this Amnesia FPS knock off. The only and I mean ONLY 2 things they should work on is a little on voice acting and a ♥♥♥♥TON on AI. This Game deserves a 5/10. It would be 4/10 if it wasnt for the games atmosphere. (SIDE NOTE: Im still on the first level)
This must be the ♥♥♥♥♥iest pewdiebait game I have ever played.

Maps are well designed but that's where the good part ends. A lot of models are taken from Half-Life 2, enemies are unkillable if shot other than the head, get hit once by the enemy and you're doomed, and they will often appear right behind you so it's highly unfair. The melee weapon is completly useless, the enemies are spawned in stupid areas, 'jumpscares' have models with no animations pass in front of you. There is a useless quest at the beggining, badly hidden easter egg, the slender one I don't even know how I got it. The first monster you see just appears behind a guy who is talking to you and everyone acts like nothing happens, then you start to wonder if it's a bug.   I stopped playing after all this.
Swastikas everywhere. 0/11  The monsters are too quick, background for loading screen and notes are just unnecessary and are out of place.

An horrible piece of crap that doesn't even looks real Features : -Terrible sprinting animations, the protagonist will keep hitting his face with his hammer if he runs with it -The first enemy has a monstrous attack speed, which leaves you to be cornered to death. Getting hit slows you down, and your pistol will barelly kill it as you cannot fire it as fast as you want -Voice acting is chubby -Story is way too linear, it looks like your average 'DUH SO SCRY HORROOOOR' game -Cheap, not scary jumpscares. -Stolen models from source games and  gamebanana.com  -'Think outside the box and you'll be rewarded, there are more than 1 solutions', or understand that there's no more than 1 option in every situation -'Running away is not an act of being a coward, blabla' If you try to run away, the monsters will follow you at an insane speed and pin you down like Shaq and basketball the ♥♥♥♥ out of your face

Not Scary. Not one bit. I think the whole purpose of this game is to attract those 'Pewdiepie' youtubers who see a monster, get a spaz attack, then they say they can't play the game anymore. I mean, its a source mod. That sort of defeats the purpose of having a scary game when everything look like a cartoon show. They give you no tutorial what so ever, and they put combat in a horror game. Thats like breaking rule number 1 of horror. The bullets they gave you are underpowered, so its not like your going to kill the enemy in the first place. Another thing, when an enemy jumps out, most of the time your in a small confined room. That makes it difficult to shoot when it runs at you extremly fast along with the fact that when it hits you, your camera swing everywhere. Enemies also have no delay in their attack time so if you get cornered, you are finished. The sound effects are kind of unsettling, but otherwise, the music and soundloops are just little things that come with source. The way items work in the game too is kind of odd. From what I see, you select the itm and click use, like Amnesia. However, when you click use, nothing happens. The item entity doesn't appear on your reticule like Amnesia, instead you have to be at point blank with your target to use the item when you click use, making you vulnerable to any monster that comes near. Another thing I have to say, hiding is useless. It says you can hide, like in normal horror games, but when it comes down to an actual encounter with a monster, they can just sniff you out. I think its default programming in source for the monsters to find you, but othern than that, I honestly don't know. For example, at one point there was a shed outside of the main building you were exploring, and I went inside and picked up a lantern. I heard a monster noise, so I closed the door and hid in a corner by some shelves. I heard two monsters run up to the shed, bang the door down, tear up my hiding spot, and kill me. They didn't even pause for a second. But all in all, I would not recomend this game to anyone who is actually going to try and play a horror game with the expectations of geting scared or having fun.
i got really dizzy playing this game. i cant seem to change any keyboard settings so i had adjust to the default. well interact being the f key was the most annoying thing.

i am a big fan of horror games, no dought about it. but this was not a horror game that i liked. the story was a bit effencive.jews from hollicosts haunting this guy. i mean come on. plus the fact that there are guns in this game makes you feel safe. in a horror game u should be able to survive without weapens. save that for zomies and moster games but not for a hauting game. not feeling safe, thats what makes a game scary. im not saying a this is a horrible game but it did not reach its expectations. and yes i get it its free and im not a big graghics guy, if u focus on graghics thatn u have no tasst in games but the story was just not solid. it tried to scare u with ghosts of jews from a devistating time. which did not make it that scary if this game was replaised by deminds and took a away the guns changed the story, and gae a twist to the end it would ahave been pretty scary.all in all i would not recemend this game to you. dont wate ur time down loading it.waste of space and time. and also the game is extremely buggy.i would not recemend this game

As a fan of survival horror i thought this game might be fun. Now I am contemplating suicide.  In all seriousness though the jumpscares are incredibly cheap and laughable, you'll be walking down corridors when a poorly modelled zombie thing slides across the floor and into a locked door with a high pitched scream and the game expects you to run away screaming 'OMG SPOCCEY GOSTE WAS NOT REDDY4FWEDDY 1SEPKKYE420MEY!' But you just keep walking, laughing uncontrollably. The enemies I saw are spaztic two-headed zombies that are poorly animated and modelled and a weird alien thing which you see as soon as you enter the hotel behind your friend who we had no idea existed until this point. I cant even follow the story and I don't give a crap about it. You probably think my expectations were too high for a mod for the source engine but just play it.  Also you play as a Jew.   I give this game a -420/10.
i deleted this right away off my library, dis is mah opinion though

a half-life 2 mod that doesn't have controller support, or mouse smoothing? No thanks.

Here's my personal experience with what little I have played of the game thus far: First off, I don't even recall downloading the game. I launch game on computer, game crashes. Open task manager and find that game is Half Life 2 mod, which is a game I do not own. So I launch it on my bfs computer and it works fine. Which was annoying as hell.  Story is hard to follow, a ceiling fan killed me, car got stuck on top of a fence, enemy spawn is super annoying...game play is quite repetitive.   Game includes achievements for finding Slenderman and Justin Bieber. Wat.  The Forgotten Ones is playable, and you get what you'd expect for a F2P game. Wouldn't recommend to someone looking for a horror game with a decent plot, though.

Dear Developer  I would have recommended this game if it were not for a 'few' minor problems; 1) Occasionally Gregor, after finishing his dialogue and choosing the options, would freeze and follow the player rather then walk into the cut sequence. 2) The enemies are too fast and too strong. To be able to call it a survival horror first the player needs to be able to survive the monster, in this case the monster is just too quick and strong to out run and fight. 3) The guns are too weak. The guns might as well be firing blanks as the guns seem to do no damage at all to the monsters, it neither hinders them nor weakens their attack.  4) When trying to pick up ammo the player seems to grab the most useless item first, this causes to fling the ammunition accross the room and into some small crevice out of reach.   Please fix these minor problems and then I'll recommend this game, thank you.
i ♥♥♥♥♥ed my pants
as soon as i saw the eagle on the intro scene i knew i wouldnt like this game
Bad collision meshes. Bad targeting system. Bad item pickup system.  BAD GAME.

Here's my personal experience with what little I have played of the game thus far: First off, I don't even recall downloading the game. I launch game on computer, game crashes. Open task manager and find that game is Half Life 2 mod, which is a game I do not own. So I launch it on my bfs computer and it works fine. Which was annoying as hell.  Story is hard to follow, a ceiling fan killed me, car got stuck on top of a fence, enemy spawn is super annoying...game play is quite repetitive.   Game includes achievements for finding Slenderman and Justin Bieber. Wat.  The Forgotten Ones is playable, and you get what you'd expect for a F2P game. Wouldn't recommend to someone looking for a horror game with a decent plot, though.
THIS GAME SUCKS ♥♥♥♥ U ♥♥♥♥ING ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, WHY WOULD YOU EVER MAKE A GAME LIKE THIS
The game is boring and i don't know what to do later on... It's not even scary, the jumpscares are so bad. I think this game needs to be improved. I will give this game 5/10

This free, little garry's mod based game is pretty decent for a random modder's game. I had a lot of trouble crawling my way through the game trying to figure out the objectives. Things weren't stright forward enough and I couldn't have done it without a guide to say the least. The achievements were a nice touch. Really hard to understand plot and tricky combat had me dying left and right. I didn't care much for the game but it was a great try. I do believe the developer should make Horror maps for G-mod in the future.
My favorite part was when I quit the game.

This free, little garry's mod based game is pretty decent for a random modder's game. I had a lot of trouble crawling my way through the game trying to figure out the objectives. Things weren't stright forward enough and I couldn't have done it without a guide to say the least. The achievements were a nice touch. Really hard to understand plot and tricky combat had me dying left and right. I didn't care much for the game but it was a great try. The Combat for this game is absolutely TERRIBLE! Don't even buy it just for that reason. The first part of the game was great and gave a good, eerie atmosphere. Once you make your first encounter with a monster, they are WAY too fast. They also swing too fast. It is almost impossible to kill a monster. You can't kill a monster without wasting more than one magazine.
I spent more time trying to join my friend than I did actually playing the game.
